content.description: Sit start with hands matched at the hueco. From there, pull on to the face, flip the hands to the undercling position, work through the edges, then move on to the bumps and a featured finish.
content.protection: At least a pair of pads. There is a rock directly the problem, but it pads well.
content.location:
It climbs the west face of Caboose, just left of

Is Is

.

content.description: Sit start on the rock with hands matched on the obvious edge. From there, cross over with a right hand to a big sloping edge, follow to a good left hand slot, bump the left hand further to a sidepull, gain and match on the jug above, follow to a sloping shelf below the lip, then use the bumps to reach an easy mantel.
content.protection: A pair of pads. The landing is great, but there are some rocks that border the fall zone.
content.location: It climbs the north section of Caboose's west face.

content.description: Sit start with a left hand sidepull and a right hand on the arete. From there, pull to a pair of good edges, move slight left to a pair of bumps, then continue upward for the finish using the highly featured slab.
content.protection: A pair of pads. The landing has a mix of rocks that is fine if you've got the padding.
content.location: It climbs the easternmost section of Caboose's west face.

content.description: Sit start with a pair of crimps. From there, make a big move to a jug hueco, move to a right hand sloper-edge, follow to the bumps above, then press out the mantel for the send.
content.protection: A pair of pads. There is a good landing, though it is slightly uneven due the hillside erosion.
content.location:
It climbs the west face of Caboose, just left of

Slay Hay

.

content.description:
Finger Me climbs a slight overhang on a solid rock over a decent landing.

Sit start with a left hand two-finger pocket and a right hand crimp. From there, pull up to a right hand crimp, gain the jug hueco with the left hand, match on it, switch the left hand to an undercling, reach a right hand sidepull-sloper at the lip, follow with a left hand to a bump, continue to the bumps above, gain an edge high on the slab, and mantel atop the boulder.
content.protection: At least a few pads. The landing has a pair of tree stumps from a previous person's efforts to cut down a juniper tree. It makes for an uneven surface.
content.location:
It climbs the west face of Caboose, just left of

Happy Human

.
